utterance.content: An act?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought that Kitchen Wars was a reality show.

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Emphasis on "show." And win or lose, you want people to remember your name when it's over. That's how you build your brand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who doesn't remember a great villain?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Exactly. Hey, we made for great TV. Why do you think they kept us on until the final two?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But then he won.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Personally, I was shocked that your oven-roasted pork belly glaze didn't take top prize. That was... just...

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: But look, we both won. Yes, Wolf got his own restaurant, but I secured financing for a catering company, and I'm doing great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then if you didn't kill him, maybe you can explain why we found your prints at the scene. They were all over the appliance used to bludgeon Mr. Wolf to death.

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Are you talking about the rotary evaporator? My prints are on it because it's mine. I loaned it to him the day before yesterday. He said he needed it to make something really special.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, you saw him the day he died?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: He called me early in the morning and asked to meet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was he carrying a backpack?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Yeah. He seemed in a rush, like he had a lot of things to do and not a lot of time to do it. I gave him the evaporator, and then he said he had a meeting in Midtown. He asked me to drop him off on my way home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where was that?

utterance.speaker: JENNIFER
utterance.content: Uh, the northeast corner of 47th and Lex-- one of those big office buildings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jennifer's employees confirm that she had a catering job in the Hamptons and that she stayed the night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, just as well. Her culinary talents would've been wasted in a prison kitchen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, you guys. I need you to check on the tenants at this address.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: 423 East 47th?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Apparently, Wolf visited someone there the day that he died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he had the backpack with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, how'd things go Uptown?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we talked to every waiter, busboy and manager at Cafe Rex. They remember Wolf coming in and said he sat at the same table out front, but he was always alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was he doing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sipping tea, staring.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sometimes, he ordered the brioche.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That's right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's it? Every day for the last two weeks? Why would he go all the way to the Upper East Side just to sit there alone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he had a rendezvous with destiny, and it stood him up. Which reminds me, what color shirt do you think Madison would like on me?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Going out with Beckett's old friend?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That's a mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, Beckett didn't seem to mind.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, honey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you want to hand me an apple?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah. Stop frowning, Alexis, or your father will freeze your face like that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He doesn't have to. I just found out I have to study slides with a microscope for my AP Chem exam. I can't take a microscope to the Hamptons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, so you're canceling your trip?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, when I'm studying, I'll want to be on the beach with the girls, and when I'm on the beach, I'll feel guilty for not studying.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, don't look at me. I'm from the "have your cake and eat it, too" school of decision making. I say do both.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe by this weekend, I'll figure out a way to take this tank of liquid nitrogen and build it into a weather machine. I'll make it rain, your friends will have to cancel their trip. You won't have to choose, and then we can take over the world!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not helpful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But evil.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Shouldn't you be getting ready for your date?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mm. Shouldn't you be back home with Chet? Oh, you're right. I... Hey. I froze time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maddie?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You look amazing.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Thanks. Hey, I, um... I wanted to drop this off. It's my way of saying thank you for everything you guys are doing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, y-- You know, it's what we do. But we are always very grateful for cookies. I love oatmeal cookies!

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: I'm glad. Hey, Becks... Do you remember when we used to like the same guy in English class?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Brent Edwards.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was very hot.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Yes. Do you also remember what happened senior year?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: This date with Rick. If you guys are at all...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? N-no.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Are you sure? Because I really wouldn't want Brent Edwards to happen all over again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trust me. It's not.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Okay. Great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So have fun tonight.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Thanks. You, too.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Uh, so you ready?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: No. My lieutenant just brought down the hammer. Fives have to be written up before shift end tonight. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Uh, you know, I have-- I have, uh, some paperwork to do as well. So maybe another time.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Well, the thing is, I kinda had my heart set on tonight. You like Chinese?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's my favourite.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Great. Wait here.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Madison, I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: It's a tragic loss. Wolf was a good friend.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Yeah, he really admired you.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: Thanks for coming tonight. It means a lot to me.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Rocco, this is Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: I ought to punch you in the face, Castle... ... for killing Derrick Storm like that. He was my favourite character. But I'll admit, Heat Wave's fun, too.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Based on my friend, Kate Beckett. I should introduce you. You guys might hit it off.

utterance.speaker: ROCCO
utterance.content: I'd like that. If she's half as interesting in person as she is on the page, I think I like her already. Well, you guys have fun. Enjoy your dinner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Fabulous chef.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You... you really think he's Beckett's type?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Well, Becks never had a type. She dated a guitarist in a grunge band, a med student, and this French guy, but I'm pretty sure he was some kind of royalty. Who is she seeing now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, just... some guy. I don't see it going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This food's amazing. Where did you get it from?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Hung's China Sea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, get out. Hung's doesn't deliver.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Well, he delivers to me. Mr. Hung had this medal-- a 15th-century Chinese medal, Ming Dynasty. It was passed down through the generations, right? Well, last year it was stolen along with some cash and some kitchen appliances and whatnot. The only thing that mattered to Mr. Hung was the medal. So I got it back for him. And because I delivered, now so does he.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Hmm. Well, then maybe I should get you to figure out why our victim was carrying a backpack full of cash.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Well, maybe you should. You know, I got some guys on the street. If you want, I can put out feelers, see if anybody knows anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Excuse me, Detectives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow. Nice candle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on in. What'd you find?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we checked the sign-in log at that building where Jennifer Wong dropped off Wolf.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turns out he was seeing a guy named Simon Haim, Esquire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was delivering a backpack full of cash to a lawyer?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, according to Mr. Haim, Wolf had the backpack in his possession, but he never opened it and he never even mentioned the cash.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But he did mention your high school friend, Madison. Apparently, Wolf wanted out of his contract. He wanted to leave the restaurant, and he wanted his investment back.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: But the restaurant just opened. Why would he want to leave?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Creative differences, but Ms. Queller refused to release him. Wolf was planning to sue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She'd built the restaurant on his reputation. If he left, she would've lost everything. So what happens to Q3 now that Wolf is dead?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She had business insurance on him. So with the payout, Madison gets the restaurant, free and clear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wolf's death protects her from potentially losing $2 million in real estate, appliances and fixtures.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Sounds like motive to me.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Mmm. Mmm. Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This... Mmm.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Mm. Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is...

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: This caviar parfait is delicious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trade you for some of my black truffle risotto with crispy shrimp.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Oh, well... how could I resist?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. Oh. Mmm. That is...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm sorry to interrupt.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I- I need to ask Madison a few questions.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Oh, well, pull up a chair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not here. Downtown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You realize Madison and I weren't halfway through our tasting menus when you stomped in there like the fun police?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What part of her being a suspect in a murder investigation do you not get?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The waiter was about to come out with the duck confit en croute, Rocco Dispirito's pumpkin gnocchi, not to mention the langoustine, the lavender crème brûlee that was coming up. And don't even get me started on the wine pairings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I won’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm just saying, you could've been more civilized and allowed us to finish our meal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unh-unh. You can watch from the observation room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And now... And now you're benching me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were just giggling over the risotto with our suspect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which was to die for, by the way.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Okay. Next time I'm hitting on a guy you like, come clean with me before I go out with him so you don't have to arrest me to break up the date.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Madison, that's not—

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. I get it. You're hot for Castle. You want to make little Castle babies. Why couldn't you just be honest?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maddie.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He can hear us.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Oh, really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Rick's behind the mirror?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Oh. Like on tv? Hey there! Sorry we missed the pumpkin gnocchi. They're really good. I have to Tweet about this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Madison, put the phone down. Sit. You lied to me. You knew that Wolf wanted out of Q3, and you knew that he was gonna sue you.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: You know about that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I know about that.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Okay, but I didn't lie. I just neglected to say anything about it. Okay, you know how hard it is to open a restaurant in Manhattan? If word got out that Wolf was trying to leave, it would've ruined me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But if he dies, with your insurance policy, you make out just fine. So what happened, Maddie? Did you guys get into a fight? Did you throw something at him? Because I remember you throwing things at people when you got angry.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Don't you people have rules about using personal knowledge against suspects?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maddie, you better start being straight with me.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Becks, I didn't kill him. Two weeks ago, Wolf tells me he wants out of the restaurant biz, completely out of nowhere. Says he's trying to change his life. Now I'm thinking he's being poached. So I start offering better equipment, a bigger piece in the business, whatever he wants. He insists he's really getting out and that I can't change his mind. It was like something changed in his life. Now I was gonna let him out of his contract. I just needed time to find a new chef. But I swear, Becks, I didn't kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don't really think she did it, do you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, until I can rule her out, it doesn't matter what I think. She has motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, she also has an alibi, which you're conveniently ignoring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm not ignoring. I'm just rechecking. I asked her to stay in town in any case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I know. I heard... everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh... so, uh, selling his stake in the restaurant, a backpack full of cash... That sounds like Wolf was getting ready to run.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but from what?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Hey, you guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. I'm so sorry to cut out on you earlier.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: No worries. It gave me time to put the word out on your vic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Well, a guy I know runs paper for a local bookmaking ring. Turns out he's a bit of a foodie. He clocked Wolf doing business with a bookie at Two Bridges bar. Apparently, your boy likes to bet big.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was in deep with a bookie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That explains the beating and the cash. Does this bookie have a name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wesley Slade? Detective Beckett, NYPD. We're investigating the murder of Balthazar Wolf.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Never heard of him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Well, given the marks on his body after the beating your boys gave him, I think you have.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened? He get in too deep with you, so you had to take him out?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: You really think I'm gonna tell my business to a cop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's either that or you face murder charges. That can't be good for business.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: All right. Let's say, hypothetically, that I made book for him. And let's say for the sake of argument that he owed me a lot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How much, hypothetically?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: 25 thou, which maybe he couldn't pay. So maybe he needed some encouragement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe the encouragement went too far.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Or maybe it was the right amount. So he paid what he owed and went his merry way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: The day he died, he comes in with a backpack full of cash, puts 25 thou on the table and asks for his ring back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His ring? What kind of ring?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Diamond engagement ring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why'd you have it? Hypothetically.

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: Couple of weeks back, I sent my guys to collect, didn't have the money, gave some sob story about a woman, how he spent everything he had on a diamond ring. So when my guys go to give him some... encouragement, oh, what do they find? A nice diamond ring. Nice. Must have set him back 10, 15 grand... of my money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So your guys took it for collateral?

utterance.speaker: WESLEY
utterance.content: No, as incentive. And it worked. I got my money, he got his ring, and he goes home alive... hypothetically.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An engagement ring makes perfect sense. That's why he broke things off with Mrs. Meyers. That's why he took $15,000 out of his account two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then where is it? He went to the restaurant right after, and we didn't find it at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless we did find it and we just didn't know it.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Just straight back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. You remember what Spike was saying about why Wolf was staying late?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, he was finishing off that cake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A cake... with a heart-shaped mold on it. (He smashes the mold on the counter and a ring comes out of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But to who? And why hasn't she come forward yet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she's scared. Maybe she's in danger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe she killed him.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Who puts an engagement ring inside a cake?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's romantic.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, pl-- it's a choking hazard. I swear, men act as though there's some cosmic reward for crazy proposals. And what a woman really wants is a man down on one knee, tears in his eyes, ring in his hand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My proposal to Gina was very romantic.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: A balloon ride is lovely, but not in February.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Her hand was shaking so much from the cold, it was difficult getting that ring on.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It was a sign.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So have you decided?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Again, David, I'm sorry for your loss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Shed any light?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So David said that he wouldn't have believed it unless I'd shown him the ring. He had no idea who Wolf was proposing to, and neither did anyone else in his life. It's like the guy was in love with a ghost.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, that'd be cool, if it was actually a ghost.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Went back through the phone logs from the restaurant and Wolf's cell. Every call's accounted for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the cafe uptown?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The waitstaff all checked out. They're adamant that Wolf never met anybody there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you have a relationship with somebody without leaving any evidence?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe the ring wasn't his. Maybe he was holding it for a friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it had to be his. Look at his behaviour-- he stops sleeping around, he was paying off his debts, he sold the one thing in life he actually cared about just to get that ring back. There's only one reason a man cleans up his act.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but murder isn't the usual response to a proposal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless you got something to lose.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He did like married women.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Have CSU re-sweep his apartment. If this girl spent any time there, she must have left some evidence behind. Hey, Maddie. Thanks for coming.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: I thought you said I was off the hook.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, uh, witnesses have you at the party until after the time of death.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Then why am I here?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Anyone ever offered you one of these?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. You?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Not yet. I had no idea Wolf was even serious with anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you think of any girl that he was close to?

utterance.speaker: MADISON
utterance.content: Every time I saw him, he was with someone different. It's hard to believe he'd ever commit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The guy lived his job 24/7. It had to be somebody at the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not necessarily. I've fallen in love with random women on the subway.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if you can think of anyone, call me.

utterance.speaker: MADISON
